timeline.bodyText:
@olegmoz I think that this method should be added to the interface: we can always create another abstractions if later we realize that Map<String, Counter> is not suitable for all Metrics implementations. Same stands for value() methods in Counter and Gauge.
Also, not inherited methods in implementations do not seem to be a good practice: it always leads to casting/operating specific implementations instead of the interfaces.
timeline.author: olenagerasimova
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,66 @@

+ * LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,

+ * SOFTWARE.

+package com.artipie.metrics.memory;
+
+import com.artipie.metrics.Metrics;
+import java.util.HashMap;
+import java.util.Map;
+import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
+import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
+
+/**
+ * {@link Metrics} implementation storing data in memory.
+ *
+ * @since 0.9
+ * @todo #231:30min Support gauges in InMemoryMetrics.
+ *  `InMemoryMetrics.gauge()` method implementation should get or create an `InMemoryGauge` by name
+ *  and store it. `InMemoryMetrics.counters()` method should be added
+ *  to create snapshot of existing gauges. Implementations are expected to be similar to counters.
+ */
+final class InMemoryMetrics implements Metrics {
+
+    /**
+     * Counters by name.
+     */
+    private final ConcurrentMap<String, InMemoryCounter> cnts = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
+
+    @Override
+    public InMemoryCounter counter(final String name) {
+        return this.cnts.computeIfAbsent(name, ignored -> new InMemoryCounter());
+    }
+
+    @Override
+    public InMemoryGauge gauge(final String name) {
+        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Get counters snapshot.
+     *
+     * @return Counters snapshot.
+     */
+    public Map<String, InMemoryCounter> counters() {

replies.bodyText: @olenagerasimova there was similar concern in PR with interfaces, see #238 . Metrics interface is for reporting metrics and what we are doing with counters and gauges may differ a lot. For the start we are storing them in memory and will print periodically to the log. It will not be the case with other metric aggregators. The fact that we can read counters map is specific for InMemoryMetrics and does not seem to be needed in other implementations I an imagine now.
replies.author: olegmoz

timeline.bodyText: @olegmoz l'd suggest returning Gauge and Counter instead of theirs implementation

replies.bodyText: @olenagerasimova that's intended, if we take a counter from InMemoryMetrics then we can read it's value
replies.author: olegmoz

timeline.bodyText: @olegmoz todo does not seem relevant: InMemoryMetrics.counters() is already implemented
